item.title: Ben add a quote by Emerson, Ralph Waldo
item.description: "I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me." -- Emerson, Ralph Waldo

item.title: Ben add a quote by Max Ernst
item.description: "When the artist finds himself he is lost. The fact that he has succeeded in never finding himself is regarded by Max Ernst as his only lasting achievement. " -- Max Ernst

item.title: Ben add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "I became educated to the fact that the greatest pain does not come zooming down from a distant planet, but from the depths of the heart. Of course, both could happen; your wife and child could leave you, and you could be sitting alone in your empty house with nothing to live for, and in addition the Martians could bore through the roof and get you." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Ben add a quote by Clarice Lispector
item.description: "Do not mourn the dead. They know what they are doing." -- Clarice Lispector

item.title: Ben add a quote by Henri Bergson
item.description: "The universe is a machine for the making of Gods." -- Henri Bergson

item.title: Ben add a quote by Joao Guimaraes Rosa
item.description: "The master is not the one who teaches; it's the one who suddenly learns." -- Joao Guimaraes Rosa

item.title: Ben add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Ben add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "I can't picture in my mind three hundred and sixty thousand dollars... When I think of it, all I can see in my mind is a big nickel." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Ben add a quote by Clarice Lispector
item.description: "I do not know much. But there are certain advantages in not knowing. Like virgin territory, the mind is free of preconceptions. Everything I do not know forms the greater part of me: This is my largesse. And with this I understand everything. The things I do not know constitute my truth." -- Clarice Lispector

item.title: Ben add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have two rules in life - to hell with it, whatever it is, and get your work done." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kit Reed
item.description:
"My novel is about the history of the world, told from the point of view of a column of stone.
(from "Wherein We Enter the Museum")" -- Kit Reed

item.title: Ben add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Ben add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Ben add a quote by John Ashbery
item.description: "Most reckless things are beautiful in some way, and recklessness is what makes experimental art beautiful, just as religions are beautiful because of the strong possibilities that they are founded on nothing." -- John Ashbery

item.title: Ben add a quote by Stephen Crane
item.description: "When it occurs to a man that nature does not regard him as important, and that she feels she would not maim the universe by disposing of him, he at first wishes to throw bricks at the temple, and he hates deeply the fact that there are no bricks and no temples." -- Stephen Crane

item.title: Ben add a quote by Norman Mailer
item.description: "Ultimately a hero is a man who would argue with the gods, and so awakens the Devils to contest his vision." -- Norman Mailer

item.title: Ben add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The most interesting information come from children, for they tell all they know and then stop." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ben add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ben add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Ben add a quote by Carlos Fuentes
item.description: "I need, therefore I imagine." -- Carlos Fuentes

item.title: Ben add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Nature is a haunted house--but Art--is a house that tries to be haunted." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Ben add a quote by Charles Fort
item.description: "I conceive of nothing, in religion, science or philosophy, that is more than the proper thing to wear, for a while." -- Charles Fort

item.title: Ben add a quote by Norman Mailer
item.description: "No heart is so hard as the timid heart." -- Norman Mailer

item.title: Ben add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment." -- Rumi

item.title: Ben add a quote by Muriel Spark
item.description: "Beware the ire of the calm." -- Muriel Spark

item.title: Ben add a quote by Mark Leidner
item.description: "Writing is beautiful, like putting on a gold suit and going to sleep in it." -- Mark Leidner

item.title: Ben add a quote by Karel Čapek
item.description: "It's not possible to search for God using the methods of a detective... There is no way. You can only wait till God's axe severs your roots: then you will understand that you are here only through a miracle, and you will remain fixed forever in wonderment and equilibrium." -- Karel Čapek

item.title: Ben add a quote by Kenneth Patchen
item.description: "Destiny is the music of the improbable. Were it otherwise, almost anyone could exist." -- Kenneth Patchen

item.title: Ben add a quote by F. Marion Crawford
item.description: "Fill your mouth with pebbles, and howl at the sea, if you cannot do anything else." -- F. Marion Crawford

item.title: Ben add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "Anything that consoles is fake." -- Iris Murdoch
